wikipedia_page.main:
Eric James Martin (17 August 1925 – 30 September 2015) played first-class cricket for Nottinghamshire between 1949 and 1959. He was born at Lambley, Nottinghamshire and died at Woodthorpe, also in Nottinghamshire.
Martin was a right-handed opening batsman. He was a regular player in the Nottinghamshire side in 1952, 1954 and 1955, and was awarded his county cap in 1954 when he made 977 runs at an average of more than 30 runs per innings.

response: *Eric Martin (1925–2015), first-class cricketer for Nottinghamshire, was born in the village.
Eric Martin or Éric Martin is the name of:
* Eric Martin (racing driver) (1969–2002), ARCA driver who was killed at the Lowes Motor Speedway
* Eric Martin (musician) (born 1960), American singer-songwriter and member of Mr. Big
* Eric Martin (wide receiver) (born 1961), former American football wide receiver
* Eric Martin (lacrosse) (born 1981), American lacrosse player for the San Jose Stealth
* Me One (born 1970), pseudonym used by rapper (and label owner) Eric Martin, of Technotronic fame
